name.japanese: ローグタウンのゴーグル店

description: A small shop in Loguetown that sells goggles and other accessories. This is where Usopp encounters Carol and Daddy Masterson, setting up the episode's main conflict.

keyEvents.title: Carol's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Carol enters the shop and argues with Usopp over a pair of goggles, which she purchases for her father Daddy Masterson.
keyEvents.significance: The shop serves as the initial meeting point that triggers the duel between Usopp and Daddy.

keyEvents.title: Daddy Masterson's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Daddy Masterson arrives at the shop to meet Carol and receives the goggles, encountering Usopp for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the initial confrontation occurs that leads to the Western-style duel.

statusHistory.reason: Shop is operational during this episode

name.japanese: ローグタウンのメインストリート

description: The main thoroughfare of Loguetown where the Western-style duel between Usopp and Daddy Masterson takes place. The street becomes an impromptu arena for their showdown.

keyEvents.title: Western-Style Duel Setup
keyEvents.description: The town gathers in the main street for a Western-style showdown between Usopp and Daddy in a classic ten-paces duel format.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms the street into a Western gunslinger arena, showcasing the anime's genre-blending aesthetic.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Attempts to Flee
keyEvents.description: Usopp tries to run away from the duel on the main street, but Daddy shoots the gun from his hand.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates both Usopp's cowardice and Daddy's exceptional marksmanship in front of the gathered crowd.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Marksmanship Displayed
keyEvents.description: Usopp successfully hits a distant weather vane from the main street with his slingshot, proving his skill to the crowd and Daddy.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Usopp proves he is worthy of his father Yasopp's legacy.

statusHistory.reason: Main street continues to be active
